content: Open source: A modern (free) apprenticeship Sahil Dua You are completely right. I think the ease and consistency of Github for code-review process has really made this very attainable. When I started developing and attempting open source contributions, the version control situation was chaotic, at best. A different configuration for everything, message boards, emails, Yahoo chat… craziness. Code reviews have essentially been universalized. This is, of course, not solely through Github, but they have a great and proven interface.
